meanings.definition: To bend the knee or touch one knee to the ground in reverence or worship.
meanings.sent1: The knight genuflected before the king in the grand hall.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the priest genuflected before the altar.
meanings.sent3: The penguin comically genuflected in front of the fish tank.
meanings.sent4: The trees genuflected in the wind's powerful presence.
meanings.sent5: She genuflected gracefully, showing her deep respect.

meanings.definition: To show respect or submission by bending the knee.
meanings.sent1: The loyal servant genuflected before his master every morning.
meanings.sent2: As a sign of respect, the samurai genuflected before his sensei.
meanings.sent3: The robot unexpectedly genuflected in front of the curious crowd.
meanings.sent4: The flowers genuflected towards the warm sunlight.
meanings.sent5: He genuflected humbly, acknowledging his mistake.
